findings.title: BC - Blacklists Addresses
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to stop addresses from transactions, which can be exploited by calling the multipleBotlistAddress function.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The swapTokensAtAmount function could produce a dramatically price volatility if the variable is set to a high number, leading to selling a huge amount of tokens in a single transaction.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library produces unnecessary additional gas as Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 do not need it.

findings.title: US - Untrusted Source
findings.description: The contract uses an untrusted external source which may produce security issues and harm transactions.

findings.title: MDA - Misleading Dead Address
findings.description: The setDeadWallet function allows the contract owner to set the deadWallet variable to any address, making it misleading and mutable.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: Solidity defines a naming convention that should be followed.

findings.title: L05 - Unused State Variable
findings.description: There are segments that contain unused state variables.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Detected missing events for critical arithmetic parameters. There are functions that have no event emitted, so it is difficult to track off-chain changes.

findings.title: L12 - Using Variables before Declaration
findings.description: The contract is using a variable before the declaration. This is usually happening either if it has not been declared yet or the variable has been declared in a different scope.

findings.title: L14 - Uninitialized Variables in Local Scope
findings.description: There are variables that are defined in the local scope and are not initialized.

findings.title: L15 - Local Scope Variable Shadowing
findings.description: Local variables have same names as upper scoped variables.
